alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 3:53AM PDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Warm temperatures for the upcoming week will melt high mountain snowpack and result in increased river flows. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM PDT Sunday the stage was 23.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late this evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM PDT.
